content.question: A study reports that 75 percent of young adults in a county get their news from online sources. A sociologist believes that the percentage is actually greater than 75 percent. The sociologist will select a random sample of young adults from around the county to interview. Which of the following is the most appropriate method for investigating the sociologistâ€™s belief?

choices.label: A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference in population proportions
A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a sample proportion
A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a population proportion
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference in population proportions
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference in sample proportions

content.answer: A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a population proportion

topic.text: 6.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
